intro: Stegnocarpus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its woody structure and the presence of a thick, fleshy fruit known as a syconium. The plants typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Stegnocarpus species are often found in regions of southern Africa, where they thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Their unique morphology and ecological role make them an important component of their native ecosystems.
